occupation: CEO & Founder at Dealls – Jobs & Mentoring (YC W22)
headline: CEO at Dealls – Jobs & Mentoring (YC W22) // 🏫 Ex-Harvard // 🔆 Building Dealls to revolutionize how Indonesian talents land their next career
summary:
I'm a graduate of Universitas Indonesia and Harvard Law School, and the first-ever Indonesian to have spoken at the Harvard Law's commencement. Last year, I built the app that won "Indonesia's Best App of 2021 by GooglePlay" – the first-ever winner from Indonesia. I am now pursuing life's calling to change Indonesian job-seeking and mentoring landscape. We grew from 0 to 2+ million users in 10 months, with no funding & staying profitable.

Life is all about momentum. Join our movement to revolutionize job-seeking and mentoring industries in Indonesia – www.usedeall.com/career

–

"Andhika has a long list of achievements. Yet, at first glance, the combination of achievements on Andhika's résumé doesn't make a lot of sense. The path to where he is today was not linear: (1) at one point he was the only operator outside of Java and the youngest in the then-largest gaming community in the country (Indogamers), (2) another time he won a silver medal Taekwondo competition. (3) He published two educational books aiming to share know-how to off-the-grid students in Indonesia, (4) conducted an internship in an art museum in China and (5) legal firm in Singapore, before later (6) went to a one-year student exchange program to Japan. (7) Andhika also founded an award-winning non-profit organization and (8) was awarded Indonesia's National Most Outstanding Student by the Ministry of Research, Technology, and Higher Education (multi-round competitions, finishing 1st place of 5+ million). (9) After passing the Indonesian bar exam and becoming Indonesian-qualified, he spent nearly three years as a corporate lawyer doing project finance and (10) worked in an Indonesian conglomerate as the chairman's assistant (business side). Spent a ‘short’ 9-month in Harvard, he graduated as (11) Harvard Law School's 2020 Dean's Award recipient, (12) Harvard Law School's 2020 Class Marshal Elect, and (13) Harvard Law School’s 2020 Commencement Ceremony Closing Speaker.

In an interview, he responded, "Everything I've been interested in, I've done well. I believe in continuous excellence and I want to be proud of what I have done. When I pursue something, I do it with a strong work ethic and an intense drive to succeed. I'm going to take it seriously and I'm going to excel."

experiences.title: CEO & Founder
experiences.description:
Deall helps companies hire curated top talents for full-time and internship roles. When companies screen 10 candidates, our data tells us they would shortlist at least 2 to the next steps. Tokopedia, Ajaib, Shopee, Amartha, IDN Media, Kompas Gramedia, Bank Aladin, Garena, and 30+ others are among our happy customers. Try us for FREE!

Top talents are prioritized here and after they upload their CV, they can know how they rank compared to other candidates. If they are good, they can even get hunted by companies.

Within our first 14 months, we had more than 2.5M+ users, won the Best App Best App of 2021 by Google (Indonesia's category), and are part of the prestigious Y Combinator family.

Want to join a passionate team that makes working feels like a fun amazing race game? www.usedeall.com/career

experiences.title: Associate
experiences.description:
Never into law but did it anyway (for financial reason).

Advised on a wide array of commercial transactions and pro bono services, including highlights:
§	The first Indonesian wind power ‘Sidrap’ project (totaling 2,000MW or approx. US$6 billion in pipeline), major coal-fired and renewable energy developments (projects regulatory risk analysis & security documents)
§	The financing of the largest government-backed drinking-water supply system project serving 300,000+ residents in eight districts in Bandar Lampung city (regulatory risk analysis, facility and security documents)
§	The Indonesian legal risk segment of the Government of Indonesia’s sovereign bonds offering circular in 2016 (USD3.5bn 144A/Reg S drawdown issued under its US$40bn GMTN program) (legal risk factors)

experiences.title: CEO & Founder
experiences.description: AdaAcara.com was a non-profit organization which sought to empower Indonesian students by publicizing opportunities such as competitions, workshops, and internships. I directed the organization and led a total of 14 volunteers during the span of three years. The initiative supported over 6,000 Indonesian students, and was named among the “Top 6 student startups at Tech in Asia Jakarta’s Bootstrap Alley” at the Tech in Asia conference 2015.

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: MIT FinTech Challenge 2020 Hackaton: 2nd RU
accomplishment_honors_awards.issuer: Martin Trust: Center for MIT Entrepreneurship & Citi
accomplishment_honors_awards.description:
MIT FinTech Challenge 2020 Hackaton was really more of a Dataton. The objective of the run was to build a model capable of detecting spoofing activities. Initially it felt like being asked to find a needle in the ocean; among the daily millions of commands-turned activities we must figure out which ones of them are spoofs. Someone sitting in Bali could be sipping cocktails and inserted their illegal slips—and we needed to figure out which is which, among the millions of it.

Our team researched, brainstormed, and fiercely debated on the best approach our team should take. Instead of the prizes, our team was instead motivated by our sole goal to create the best model someone could ever thought of. We believed our solution must be unique—best if it’s something something easy to build, explain, and implement. Clearly it wasn’t easy, but not impossible either. After hours-long debate, we were convinced that a monitoring tool with multiple layers of flagging systems is the way to go. Intent is difficult to tell—but our MRMS (mens rea metering system) measures spectrum of possibilities instead of utilizing the traditional binary system most other teams thought of. Second-level “70%” bar is first alerted to the direct supervisor before the ticket goes to the MD, and later the compliance team. If someone repeatedly walks into the holes we dig, we could argue better they had ill intentions. The next challenge was to provide non-quantitative ways including policies and procedures (e.g. leveraging psychology or behavioral economics) to tackle the US spoofing issues. From data, we now needed to jump into law, econs, and psychology—all this, in 24 hours.

On the second day, our team delivered the model using multiple analytics techniques including unsupervised machine learning. We were awarded 2nd RU. Other teams had 7 members (upper limit) and we only had 3 members. We were strong. We learned a lot. It was absolutely one of my best 24 hours.
